availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry G. Black (Ballard County, Kentucky, county surveyor)

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, county surveyor. Pennsylvania native. Married to Elizabeth Black. Father of Mary F. Black, Thomas C. Black, John H. Black, James D. Black, George Black, Oscar Turner Black, Ann T. Black, and Sagamon Black. County surveyor in Ballard County in 1850 and 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, p. 270. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Blandville District, p. 10. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, District No. 8, p. 28. Bob Milner and Carolyn MilnerCarlisle County Kentucky Cemeteries: "Gone but not Forgotten", vol. 2(Bardwell, Ky.: Bob & Carolyn Milner, 1989), p. 23. Find A Grave, "Henry Gardner Black (1807-1893)," Memorial #103676347, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=103676347&ref=acom (accessed September 12, 2017).
